intro: Spermacoce galioides, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in woodland and shrubland habitats. The botanical features of Spermacoce galioides make it an attractive species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
